item.title: R.I.P Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: @baymandernam baymandernam
item.description:
@baymandernam wrote:

Yes, the world lost a great man. however, his death should not be glorified for he was just like you and I, a normal man. he died shortly after he retired from apple which further gives us a reason to NOT glorify his death. though he was a great visionary and loved by many he was a normal, average man during his time of death. do not mourn over the death of others, celebrate their life and thank god that you are still alive.

Read full topic

item.title: R.I.P Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:61, topic:417147”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=519085.msg3774933#msg3774933 date=1318020301]

[quote]Easier to use, longer battery life, sleeker, ipods also have buttons or stuff u can actually click.[/quote]I can say all of those about my Sansa. And you didn’t even mention anything wrong with the Sansa to begin with.
[/quote]

Sansa has a short battery life, dies after using for 2 days after 2 hours each. I have have a hard time switching between songs and then skipping half way through a song because its like a slide type technology or whatever u call it. It’s 80 dollars at best buy, I could get a new Ipod Shuffle (new one) for that much. I would be MUCH happier.[/quote]My Sansa has an extremely long battery life (about 15-16 hours). I spent like $80 on it in like 2007 and it’s still working fine. I use RockBox though so I can use a lot more features. An iPod shuffle is a complete piece of shit.

Read full topic

item.title: R.I.P Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:62, topic:417147”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=519085.msg3774926#msg3774926 date=1318019718]
I don’t know about this thread, but to me he was a great guy. I don’t own a single apple product. But that does not matter. He was a great inventor, visionary and a genuis. Because of him Apple is as big as it is today.
I respect the guy and I saw his death coming but didn’t want this to happen.

If I had a company like Apple and had cancer I would pay ANY price for a cure. (For those, including my stupid networking teacher, that say that if he didn’t spend Apple’s money on his health he would die earlier.)
[/quote]He wasn’t a great guy. He was a douchebag and asshole. Ignoring all inventions, he cheated his way to the top by fucking his friends over.[/quote]I heard he was only like that until he got married and had kids. After that he was a totally different person.

Read full topic

item.title: R.I.P Steve Jobs

item.description:

RSCShadow:

[quote]Easier to use, longer battery life, sleeker, ipods also have buttons or stuff u can actually click.[/quote]I can say all of those about my Sansa. And you didn’t even mention anything wrong with the Sansa to begin with.

Sansa has a short battery life, dies after using for 2 days after 2 hours each. I have have a hard time switching between songs and then skipping half way through a song because its like a slide type technology or whatever u call it. It’s 80 dollars at best buy, I could get a new Ipod Shuffle (new one) for that much. I would be MUCH happier.

item.title: R.I.P Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:27, topic:417147”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=519085.msg3773134#msg3773134 date=1317863337]

[quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=519085.msg3773120#msg3773120 date=1317862902]

[quote author=reyx7 link=topic=519085.msg3773116#msg3773116 date=1317862784]

Never liked Apple or owned any of their products.

Never had an iPod?
[/quote]Is it an Apple product…?

What’s not to LIKE about an iPod, is how I should’ve phrased it.
[/quote]Overpriced and not as “hackable” as other MP3 players. Plus the fact that they use their own software & try to avoid Linux support pisses me off.

Never liked any other mp3, the interface is easy and understandable and I’ve spent 0$ on songs and yet I have well over 1000.
[/quote]I’m not talking about the music itself. Anyone can pirate. And I don’t know what isn’t easy about a Sansa for instance. It’s a similar layout and there isn’t much to get confused with…[/quote]

Sansa sucks rotten asshole. I bought one from this retard for 30 dollars, ipod is way better. Easier to use, longer battery life, sleeker, ipods also have buttons or stuff u can actually click, i like that.

Read full topic

item.title: R.I.P Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

I don’t know about this thread, but to me he was a great guy. I don’t own a single apple product. But that does not matter. He was a great inventor, visionary and a genuis. Because of him Apple is as big as it is today.
I respect the guy and I saw his death coming but didn’t want this to happen.

If I had a company like Apple and had cancer I would pay ANY price for a cure. (For those, including my stupid networking teacher, that say that if he didn’t spend Apple’s money on his health he would die earlier.)

Read full topic

item.title: R.I.P Steve Jobs
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:46, topic:417147”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=519085.msg3773664#msg3773664 date=1317922865]
Don’t ever say Steve didn’t do anything for you because he invented the mouse and the graphical user interface, both of which all of us use every day.

R.I.P Steve Jobs.
[/quote]He didn’t invent the GUI either.[/quote]

It was a concept that Steve Jobs and the Apple Corporation are known for. It is what Microsoft was sued for because they copied the GUI of Apple. That’s how I read it in research papers.
